<h1 align="center">
  ITense Blog
</h1>

Blog with fantasy stories, alogithms and programming languages learning topics and fewmore things. Everything made by me from sratch using Gatsby.js as Front-end and Strapi as Content Managment System.

## 🚀 Quick start

Download repository and install node_modules in folloeing way.

````shell
git clone https://github.com/Hooded22/IT-in-society-blog.git
npm install
````
Next start development mode like this:

```shell
npm start
````
## 💻 Ready works reasult ##

Blog is hosting and works in web. You can find this on the link:  
https://itense.netlify.app/

## 🧐 What's inside?

A quick look at the top-level files and directories you'll see in a project.

    .
    ├── node_modules
    ├
    ├── src
    ├      └── componets
    ├      ├            └──pageTemplates
    ├      ├── env
    ├      ├── css
    ├      ├── modules
    ├      ├── Images
    ├      └── pages
    ├── .gitignore
    ├── .prettierrc
    ├── gatsby-browser.js
    ├── gatsby-config.js
    ├── gatsby-node.js
    ├── gatsby-ssr.js
    ├── LICENSE
    ├── package-lock.json
    ├── package.json
    └── README.md

## 🎓 What I learned buid it ##
Because I am amaoutr and this project is a part of my portfolio I wanto to tell what experience and new skills this website gave me.

* Gatsby.js
* API REST
* Strapi
* React hooks
* React routers
* Deploying in Heroku
* System of version control: GIT (branches and remote repo)
